CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Enforcement proceedings;Article 6-1 - Access to court);Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property (Article 1 para. 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Peaceful enjoyment of possessions)
JUDGES: Branko Lubarda;Georgios A. Serghides;Pere Pastor Vilanova
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant brought civil proceedings against ORG of the Sakha ( GPE Republic ( “ the Administration ” ) , a private person PERSON , her husband PERSON , and a private company A. claiming a title to a flat , damages , and PERSON ’s eviction from the flat .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of the Sakha ( GPE Republic ( “ the GPE ” ) refused to consider his action , because there already had been a decision of DATE taken by ORG concerning the same dispute .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of the Sakha ( GPE Republic overruled the refusal and remitted the case for a new examination , as the action included a new co - defendant , and , therefore , it could not be said that the dispute was among the same parties .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered eviction of S. and her family from the flat and dismissed the claim against the ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of the Sakha ( GPE Republic quashed the judgment on appeal and returned the case for a fresh examination , as the lower court had failed to address issues related S. ’s property rights .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered an expert examination of the flat in order to determine its market value .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court proceedings resumed .

CARDINAL . NORP In the meantime , the applicant amended his claims and sought to obtain compensation for his belongings allegedly stolen in DATE , nonpecuniary damage , legal costs , travel expenses and reimbursement of the rent he had to pay after his eviction from the disputed flat back in DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG examined the case , ordered the ORG to pay the applicant MONEY ( RUB ) in respect of the flat ’s market value and dismissed the remainder of the claims . In particular , the claim for compensation for the allegedly stolen property was dismissed as unfounded .
CARDINAL . On DATE the judgment was upheld on appeal by ORG ( GPE ) and entered into force .
CARDINAL . On DATE , upon the applicant ’s request , the bailiffs initiated the enforcement proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG granted the ORG ’s request for suspension of the enforcement of the judgment of CARDINAL DATE until DATE due to financial difficulties encountered by the debtor .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s appeal against the above decision was dismissed .
CARDINAL . On DATE the monetary award in accordance with the judgment of CARDINAL DATE was paid to the applicant .

CARDINAL . On DATE , upon the applicant ’s extraordinary appeal , the Presidium of ORG ( GPE ) quashed the judgment of CARDINAL DATE and the decision of DATE and remitted the case for a fresh examination . The ORG found that the courts had incorrectly applied the material law to various aspects of the case , and had failed to join the appropriate financial body as co - defendant .
CARDINAL . It appears that the amounts paid to the applicant under the quashed judgment of CARDINAL DATE have not been reclaimed .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG suspended the proceedings , due to B. ’s illness and asked the applicant to clarify his claims .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant submitted the amended claims .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG joined , at the defendant ’s request , ORG as co - defendant in the proceedings and suspended the examination of the case on account of PERSON ’s poor state of health .
CARDINAL . On DATE the case was assigned to a different judge of ORG , for the sake of the court ’s impartiality .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s action .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( GPE ) upheld the judgment on appeal except for the parts concerning the eviction of LOC and B. , reimbursement of the rent , payments for utility services , a commission fee , and recovering of the cost of the apartment . The decision in those parts was remitted for a fresh examination due to failure by the lower court to assess certain evidence and misapplication of the material law .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG suspended the proceedings pending PERSON ’s return from vacation .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court ordered the applicant to clarify his claims and scheduled a new hearing on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court issued a special writ ordering the bailiffs to obtain clarifications of the claims from the applicant .
CARDINAL . It appears that at some point the applicant provided the required information .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the action as unfounded . The court explained that the applicant had other remedies to use under the civil law in order to protect his property rights . In particular , he could claim that an equivalent apartment or a compensation be provided to him .
CARDINAL . By the final judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG ( GPE ) upheld the lower court ’s findings on appeal .
CARDINAL . In the meantime , the applicant sued the ORG for statutory interest for the delay in enforcement of the judgment of CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG discontinued the proceedings as the judgment of CARDINAL DATE had been quashed and a new decision in the case had not yet been adopted .
